ability.name: Fire Formation
ability.text: Each of Charizard's attacks does 10 more damage for each Fire Pokémon on your Bench to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charizard.

ability.name: Competitiveness
ability.text: If you don't have a Supporter card in play, each of Probopass's attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Top Chop
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Top Accelerator
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If that card isn't a basic Energy card, discard it. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Convert Blow
attacks.text: If Toxicroak has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Toxicroak has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tumble Down
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Fighting Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Primal Tentacles
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, and Old Amber in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Boosted Voltage
attacks.text: If Raichu has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy card attached to Raichu.

attacks.name: Leaf Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Graveler does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Water Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Pelipper.

attacks.name: Magical Needle
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cloak Scale
attacks.text: If you have Wormadam Sandy Cloak in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Cloak Headbutt
attacks.text: If you have Wormadam Trash Cloak in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Primal Scythe
attacks.text: You may discard Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber from your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bunny Hop
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Ice Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, Wingull can't use Slashing Strike.

cards.name: Professor Oak's Visit
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then, choose a card from your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Dome Fossil
text: Play Dome Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Dome Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Dome Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Dome Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Dome Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Helix Fossil
text: Play Helix Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Helix Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Helix Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Helix Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Helix Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Tangrowth

ability.name: Healing Growth
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tangrowth is affected by a Special Condition.

text: Put this card onto your Active Tangrowth. Tangrowth LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

attacks.name: Big Growth
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for as many Grass Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

ability.name: Snow Gift
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Froslass from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ground Frost
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magma Mantle
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire or Metal Energy card you discarded.

attacks.name: Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Gadget Bolt
attacks.text: If Luxray has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, you may do 100 damage instead of 60 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, discard that Pokémon Tool card.

cards.name: Ultimate Zone
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
During each player's turn, the player may move an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon to his or her Active Arceus as often as he or she likes.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Tangrowth by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Tangrowth. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Tangrowth's, this attack does 120 damage instead.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Zapdos .

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Zapdos . If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

attacks.name: Oracle Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Antigravity
attacks.text: The Retreat Cost for Bronzong is 0 until the end of your next turn.

ability.name: Curse
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Skip
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Baby Steps
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Recruit
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Supporter card you find there, and discard it. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Extend Fang
attacks.text: If Raticate has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Ponyta and put it onto Ponyta. (This counts as evolving Ponyta.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If you played Beedrill from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Arceus

ability.name: Multitype
ability.text: Arceus LV.X's type is the same type as its previous Level.

text: Put this card onto your Active Arceus. Arceus LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

attacks.name: Meteor Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 100.

cards.name: Salamence

ability.name: Double Fall
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Salamence LV.X from your hand onto your Active Salamence, you may use this power. For each of your opponent's Pokémon that is Knocked Out by damage from Salamence's attacks this turn, take 1 more Prize card.

text: Put this card onto your Active Salamence. Salamence LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

attacks.name: Steam Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Salamence.

ability.name: Star Barrier
ability.text: As long as Ponyta has any Energy attached to it, Ponyta has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Blue Fire
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Ponyta.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy attached to Arceus.

attacks.name: Fastwave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Arceus with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Metal Barrier
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Arceus by Pokémon LV.X during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Damage Roller
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until the Defending Pokémon has the same remaining HP as Swalot. (If the Defending Pokémon has the same or less remaining HP as Swalot, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Entangle Tackle
attacks.text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attacks.name: Cloak Party
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Burmy and Wormadam, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Unearth
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Cloudy Sky
ability.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon or Fire Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Dowsing Code
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you put Porygon-Z from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Gulpin would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Gulpin is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Gengar

ability.name: Level-Down

text: Put this card onto your Active Gengar. Gengar LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

attacks.name: Compound Pain
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Energy Restore
text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Hidden Poison
ability.text: If Haunter is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Haunter is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tongue Spring
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Lucky Egg
text: Attach Lucky Egg to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
When the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Expert Belt
text: Attach Expert Belt to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +20 HP and that Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 more Prize card.

ability.name: Cloak Evolution

attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Buffer Piece
text: Attach Buffer Piece to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

Any damage done to the Pokémon this card is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.

cards.name: Beginning Door
text: Search your deck for Arceus, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
